ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Druid question
ygData.msgSnippet: It s a great thing to do...it helps with the overcrowding.  Being a Druid. You can understand the nature of what happens when too many bears exist without
ygData.messageBody:
It's a great thing to do...it helps with the overcrowding. Being a Druid.
You can understand the nature of what happens when too many bears exist
without known predators. So yes it is a good thing. My suggestion is to
never put the furry friends out of their misery anywhere near the druid ring
or other bears. They just won't understand how your are trying to help
them.

Try this...if you see a Young Kodiak....cast snare....Panic animal...hit em
in the butt with your stick (please no beastiality here...that ISN'T helpful
for nature). and repeat as needed.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jim Fullerton [SMTP:jimbob@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 22, 2001 3:56 PM
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EverQuest] Druid question
>
> Hi, all. I'm relatively new to the list (been reading it for a month or
> so, but I've never posted before).
>
> Here's my question: My lvl 10 Druid is currently in EC and I desperately
> want to start hunting bears, would this be a bad
> thing for a Druid to do?
>
> Hest, lvl 10 Druid on Teris Thule
>
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
